skill.description: Turn Notion specs into implementation plans, tasks, and progress tracking; use when implementing PRDs/feature specs and creating Notion plans + tasks from them.
skill.summary: Turn Notion specs into implementation plans, tasks, and progress tracking; use when implementing PRD...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Provides workflow guidance for using Notion MCP tools to create implementation plans and tasks.

content.user_title: Convert Notion specs to implementation plans
content.value_statement: Translating product specifications into actionable implementation plans can be disorganized and error-prone. This skill provides a structured workflow for converting Notion specs into linked implementation plans, tasks, and progress tracking.
actual_capabilities: Parse Notion specifications for requirements and acceptance criteria
Create structured implementation plans linked to source specs
Generate properly sized tasks with acceptance criteria
Establish bidirectional links between spec, plan, and tasks
Track progress with status updates and milestone summaries
Maintain synchronized checklists and status fields
limitations: Requires Notion MCP connection and OAuth authentication
Cannot access local files or execute shell commands
Does not generate actual code or implementation artifacts
Limited to Notion's API capabilities for page and database operations

use_cases.title: Turn PRDs into actionable work
use_cases.description: Convert product requirement documents stored in Notion into detailed implementation plans and task breakdowns

use_cases.title: Plan complex feature rollouts
use_cases.description: Transform multi-phase feature specifications into structured plans with dependencies, risks, and milestone tracking

use_cases.title: Maintain spec-to-task traceability
use_cases.description: Create bidirectional links between specifications, plans, and tasks to maintain visibility throughout implementation

prompt_templates.title: Parse Spec
prompt_templates.scenario: Read and analyze a Notion spec
prompt_templates.prompt: Use notion-search to find specs matching '[search term]', then use notion-fetch to retrieve the content. Parse for requirements, acceptance criteria, constraints, and priorities.

prompt_templates.title: Create Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an implementation plan page using notion-create-pages. Include overview, linked spec reference, requirements summary, phases, dependencies, risks, and success criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Create Tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the task database and create individual task pages sized to 1-2 days each. Include context, objective, acceptance criteria, dependencies, and relations to the spec and plan.

prompt_templates.title: Track Progress
prompt_templates.prompt: Post progress updates using the progress-update-template. Update checklist items, status fields, and note any blockers or decisions made during implementation.

output_examples.input: Convert the API authentication spec into an implementation plan with linked tasks
output: Plan page created with overview, requirements summary, and 5 phased implementation steps
12 tasks generated sized to 1-2 days each with acceptance criteria
All tasks linked to plan page and source specification
Dependencies mapped between tasks with risk considerations noted

best_practices: Always link artifacts bidirectionally so teams can trace from code back to requirements
Size tasks to 1-2 days maximum to maintain progress visibility
Document assumptions and clarifications before creating the implementation plan
anti_patterns: Creating tasks without acceptance criteria leads to scope ambiguity
Skipping the clarifications step results in implementation surprises
Missing links between spec, plan, and tasks breaks traceability

faq.question: Does this skill work offline?
faq.answer: No, this skill requires an active Notion MCP connection to search, fetch, create, and update pages in your workspace.

faq.question: Can I use this with any Notion workspace?
faq.answer: Yes, as long as you have Notion MCP configured and OAuth access to the workspace containing your specs and task databases.

faq.question: What task sizes work best?
faq.answer: Tasks should be sized to 1-2 days maximum. This provides good progress visibility and makes blockers easy to identify quickly.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my existing Notion setup?
faq.answer: This skill works with your existing Notion databases. You specify which task database to use and it creates properly formatted pages within that database.

faq.question: Is my spec data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: All data stays within your Notion workspace. The skill uses Notion's official MCP API which operates directly on your connected workspace.

faq.question: How is this different from manual Notion planning?
faq.answer: This skill provides a proven workflow structure ensuring nothing is missed and all artifacts stay properly linked for traceability.
